metadata.Title: CVE-2017-8422 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high
metadata.Description:
KDE kdelibs before 4.14.32 and KAuth before 5.34 allow local users to gainroot privileges by spoofing a callerID and leveraging a privileged helperapp.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-8422` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

kdelibs-bin - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.5
kdelibs5-data - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.5
kdelibs5-plugins - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.5
kdoctools - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.5
libkcmutils4 - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.5
libkde3support4 - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.5
libkdeclarative5 - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.5
libkdecore5 - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.5
libkdesu5 - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.5
libkdeui5 - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.5
libkdewebkit5 - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.5
libkdnssd4 - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.5

libkmediaplayer4 - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.5
libknewstuff2-4 - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.5
libknewstuff3-4 - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.5
libknotifyconfig4 - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.5

libkparts4 - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.5
libkprintutils4 - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.5
libkpty4 - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.5
libkrosscore4 - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.5
libkrossui4 - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.5
libktexteditor4 - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.5
libkunitconversion4 - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.5

libnepomuk4 - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.5

libthreadweaver4 - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: kde4libs package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.5').
